intro: Mollugo flavescens subsp. gracillima, commonly known as the slender bladderwort, is a small, herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, hairless stems and small, yellowish-green leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in small inflorescences. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is considered a rare and specialized species within the family Mollugaceae.
